titles.title: Economic Stabilization and Recovery Act of 1987
A bill entitled the "Economic Stabilization and Recovery Act of 1987".

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking.

committee.name: Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

bill.summary: 10/29/1987--Introduced. Economic Stabilization and Recovery Act of 1987 - Directs the Federal Reserve Board (Board) to reduce the discount rate (interest rate on loans to member banks) to five percent. Directs the Secretary of the Treasury, in conjunction with the Board's action, to make efforts to achieve a coordinated, simultaneous, multilateral interest rate reduction among the major industrialized nations known as the G-5.
